metadata.synopsis: Halsin addresses a player to whom he's romantically linked  in a private room in the Elfsong tavern. They discuss what comes next. This scene occurs shortly after the final victory over the absolute, a day or so after the battle. Player and Halsin are implied to have spent the night together.

3.speaker: Halsin
3.text: When we joined battle for the last time, I did not want to presume we would survive. I assumed it might cost us our lives in order to save nature's realm.
3.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

112.speaker: Halsin
112.text: When we joined battle for the last time, I did not want to presume we would survive. I assumed it might cost us our lives in order to save nature's realm.
112.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

28.speaker: Halsin
28.text: I thought that would be the steepest price that could be asked of us. But I was wrong.
28.context:
NodeContext: 
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

6.speaker: Halsin
6.text: You made a choice that would cause most to tremble. You made a sacrifice far greater than merely laying down your life. Your whole future, utterly altered. The world is in your debt, and I am in awe of you.
6.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

1.speaker: Player
1.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

100.speaker: Halsin
100.text: I am glad you feel that way, for I fear what awaits you will be difficult. There are few places you could go where your new form will not inspire fear, anger... violence.
100.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

86.speaker: Halsin
86.text: You need to remove yourself from that danger - go wherever you can find solitude, peace. Nature's realm is vast - it shall provide a place where you can be yourself.
86.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

14.speaker: Player
14.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

82.speaker: Halsin
82.text: A sorry prize, yes. One that I wish was not so... but the world has a narrow view of who can be its saviour.
82.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

30.speaker: Halsin
30.text: But I know what you did. I shall not forget, and I shall make it my purpose to tell all of what you did for them.
30.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

0.speaker: Halsin
0.text: I can start to do so almost immediately - the wars of late have left many with nowhere to turn... Many lost their families, their homes - some never had them to begin with.
0.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

34.speaker: Halsin
34.text: Perhaps in time, I can trust them to meet their saviour. Perhaps you can come to visit us, and be treated with all the reverence you deserve. That day may be distant. But I shall do everything in my power to hasten it.
34.context:
NodeContext: A little hopeful that this may not be goodbye forever.
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: You sell yourself short - this is your dream. If you want me to be part of it, your followers will listen.
91.context: NodeContext: Reconsidering a little. Could he actually find a way to stay with his mind flayer lover?

117.speaker: Halsin
117.text: That would surely test even the most open-minded... yet, perhaps I am wrong to hesitate.
117.context: NodeContext: Reconsidering a little. Could he actually find a way to stay with his mind flayer lover?

49.speaker: Halsin
49.text: A new start must be without limits, or otherwise how would we ever know what we are capable of?
49.context: NodeContext: Reconsidering a little. Could he actually find a way to stay with his mind flayer lover?

113.speaker: Halsin
113.text: Let us try. It would be a sorry dream that does not make room for all who would wish to partake in it. Nature will find its balance, and if we are worthy, it will provide us with harmony.
113.context: NodeContext: Throwing caution to the wind/giving tentacle love a chance.

12.speaker: Halsin
12.text: But still... we had best make your introduction carefully, and gradually. After all they have been through, I would hate to frighten the children - and the adults, for that matter.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: Farewell. I hope our paths cross again in the future.
22.context:
NodeContext: A little hopeful that this may not be goodbye forever.
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

109.speaker: Halsin
109.text: As do I. Be safe. Seek peace. Let nature guard you and provide for you. And know that there are those who will keep you in their hearts, always.
109.context:
NodeContext: A little hopeful that this may not be goodbye forever.
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

67.speaker: Player
67.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

2.speaker: Halsin
2.text: I wish it could be so... but a new task awaits me.
2.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I saved the world. I deserve better.
33.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

70.speaker: Halsin
70.text: You do. But I fear the world is ignorant to its debt, at least for now.
70.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: I feared this would be the case...
63.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

73.speaker: Halsin
73.text: Because you are wise. You know the fear and mistrust that can grip people's hearts all too easily. There are cruel limits to who they can accept as their saviour.
73.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: It is the better of two beasts. At least I did not become Bhaal's.
20.context:
NodeContext: Romanrtic longing, seeing through the player's new form
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: Awe? You don't find me... unnatural?
88.context:
NodeContext: Romanrtic longing, seeing through the player's new form
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

24.speaker: Halsin
24.text: I thought that last night would have proven otherwise. I know your true nature. It is still there. It still intoxicates me.
24.context:
NodeContext: Romanrtic longing, seeing through the player's new form
Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

107.speaker: Halsin
107.text: But I fear what awaits you will be difficult. There are few places you could go where your new form will not inspire fear, anger... violence.
107.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

36.speaker: Player
36.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

8.speaker: Halsin
8.text: I fear what awaits you will be difficult. There are few places you could go where your new form will not inspire fear, anger... violence.
8.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: It was a mistake. There must have been another way.
29.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

27.speaker: Halsin
27.text: Do not torment yourself with paths not taken. You did what was necessary.
27.context: NodeContext: Bittersweet parting of ways between Halsin and his lover, who transformed into a mind flayer in order to save the world.

95.text: When we joined battle for the last time, I did not want to presume we would survive. To feel your touch again seemed like a distant dream. That made last night all the sweeter.

79.speaker: Halsin
79.text: When we joined battle for the last time, I did not want to presume we would survive. To feel your touch again seemed like a distant dream. That made last night all the sweeter.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: Not to mention exhausting. I don't know where you get your energy from.

45.speaker: Halsin
45.text: Do not be so modest - you gave as good as you got.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Why do I get the feeling you're about to say goodbye?

42.speaker: Halsin
42.text: Because I am. At least for now.

90.speaker: Halsin
90.text: Part of me wishes we could stay in this room forever, you and I... but there is a new dawn breaking. And I have a part to play.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I remember you saying you wanted to seek a way for everyone to live a better life.

108.speaker: Halsin
108.text: The wars of late have left many with nowhere to turn... Many lost their families, their homes - some never had them to begin with.

37.speaker: Halsin
37.text: They need help - help that this city cannot provide right now. I shall aid them to make a new place for themselves, in Thaniel's realm, under nature's watch.

43.speaker: Halsin
43.text: Now is the time for us to take care of each other. Already, people are gathering to depart. The promise of a new life inspires great haste.

106.speaker: Halsin
106.text: At last count, there were nine whole wagons of children in tow. They are my duty now. 'Daddy Halsin', they call me. Who am I to tell them otherwise?
106.context: NodeContext: Indulgent chuckle and shake of the head on 'Daddy Halsin'.

87.speaker: Player
87.context: NodeContext: Modest but hopeful for the future

10.speaker: Halsin
10.text: Better than Archdruid ever did. The old teachings could not have foreseen this world; I can see a new way to serve nature now - a path that all can follow, if they wish.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: It seems your dream of a better life for all might just come to pass.
58.context: NodeContext: Modest but hopeful for the future

111.speaker: Halsin
111.text: It is but a sprouting acorn for now, but given time and care, it could grow tall and mighty - and offer shelter to all who need it.
111.context: NodeContext: Modest but hopeful for the future

54.speaker: Halsin
54.text: You must visit as soon as you can - there will be much for you to see, and not a soul among our numbers who will not wish to praise the saviour of Baldur's Gate.

72.speaker: Halsin
72.text: And I... well, I shall have my own selfish reasons for wanting to see you again, if you wish the same.

101.speaker: Halsin
101.text: 'Visit as soon as I can?' Don't be an ass, Halsin. I'll come with you right now.
101.context: NodeContext: Taken aback/doesn't dare to hope the player is being serious.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: 'Visit as soon as I can?' Don't be an ass, Halsin. I'll come with you right now.
41.context: NodeContext: Taken aback/doesn't dare to hope the player is being serious.

56.speaker: Halsin
56.text: You... you shall? But what about all that you'll miss out on? Your name will be feted in this city - there will be parades, medals, feasts, hands to be shaken, babies to be kissed...
56.context: NodeContext: Taken aback/doesn't dare to hope the player is being serious.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I've never been more sure. Ready when you are.

32.speaker: Halsin
32.text: Well... then let us make haste. You have quite a few little fans who will be overjoyed to make your acquaintance.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Perhaps I'm being hasty. Perhaps we should go our separate ways.

89.speaker: Halsin
89.text: Then I will watch the horizon for you each day, and fix your image in my mind each night, until I feel your touch again.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Our hearts roam free, remember? Tend to your new dream - our paths will cross if it's meant to be.

50.speaker: Halsin
50.text: You are right, of course. There are no mistakes in nature - it is all a grand tapestry beyond mortal reckoning.

57.speaker: Halsin
57.text: You live your life, and I shall live mine... but forgive me the odd hopeful glance towards the horizon, in search for you.
57.context: NodeContext: Understandng, with some hope/sign he'll still hold a candle for you

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Time will tell, I suppose. I'm a busy adventurer.
16.context: NodeContext: Undaunted and confident in the face of the player's coyness.

98.speaker: Halsin
98.text: Have no fear. I am exceedingly patient.
98.context: NodeContext: Undaunted and confident in the face of the player's coyness.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: No. I think our paths are meant to diverge here.

9.speaker: Halsin
9.text: I see... After all my years of living, I know all too well that nothing lasts forever. Yet a parting can sting, nonetheless.

51.speaker: Halsin
51.text: But that just means what we shared was precious, and will live on in my memory. Thank you - I am a richer man for having met you.

62.speaker: Halsin
62.text: *You try to answer, but a tide of searing-hot pain crashes over you.*
62.context: NodeContext: Solemn - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

21.speaker: Narrator
21.text: *You try to answer, but a tide of searing-hot pain crashes over you.*
21.context: NodeContext: Solemn - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Halsin, I... I can't... my engine...
17.context: NodeContext: Solemn - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

35.speaker: Halsin
35.text: Of course - somehow I'd hoped for a miracle. But of course, the only miracles are those we make ourselves.
35.context: NodeContext: Solemn - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

97.speaker: Halsin
97.text: You can still save yourself, Karlach. You can return to Avernus. It need not be forever. Just long enough to give yourself a chance.
97.context: NodeContext: Unwilling to give up - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

39.speaker: Player
39.context: NodeContext: Torn between lover and responsibilities. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

53.speaker: Halsin
53.text: To Avernus? The land of lost souls...? I cannot. There are people who depend on me now.
53.context: NodeContext: Torn between lover and responsibilities. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

52.speaker: Halsin
52.text: At least... for now, they depend on me. But perhaps given time, their roots will grow strong enough that they can stand without me.
52.context: NodeContext: Some hope.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

110.speaker: Halsin
110.text: I could seek you out, or you could return to me, if Avernus were to yield a cure.
110.context: NodeContext: Some hope.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

60.speaker: Halsin
60.text: This need not be a parting, so long as you fight on. You and I can each roam apart, until nature compels our paths to cross once again.
60.context: NodeContext: Some hope.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I'm not sure I can, Halsin. Not alone.
38.context: NodeContext: Sincere/romantic.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

47.speaker: Halsin
47.text: Do as you must, as shall I. We shall meet again. It is as sure as the break of dawn, or the spring thaw.
47.context: NodeContext: Sincere/romantic.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

119.speaker: Player
119.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

23.speaker: Halsin
23.text: You are afraid because you are alive, and you have something to lose. Hold on to that.
23.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

74.speaker: Halsin
74.text: I have responsibilities. People who are counting on me. But perhaps given time, their roots will grow strong enough that they can stand without me.
74.context: NodeContext: Some hope.Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: No - never. I'd rather die here than try to survive there. All I want now is to see the sky one last time.
48.context: NodeContext: Sadded but respectful. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

31.speaker: Halsin
31.text: If this is what you truly want... I shall respect your wishes. But know that you shall not die - not truly. Nature's realm shall be yours. In the air, the trees, the waters.
31.context: NodeContext: Sadded but respectful. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

65.speaker: Halsin
65.text: You shall live on. And wherever I go, I shall feel your presence, and you mine.
65.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Try to focus. The inferno in your chest is reaching fever pitch.
64.context: NodeContext: Concerned - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

96.speaker: Halsin
96.text: Karlach - you are in pain. Do not say otherwise. It is writ large across your face.
96.context: NodeContext: Concerned - talking to Karlach, his love interest who has potentially-fatal infernal condition.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: A new community, raised by your hands? I'd like to see that.
18.context: NodeContext: 'You know me - I'm a free agent'

5.speaker: Halsin
5.text: And so you shall, as soon as you come to visit - there will be much for you to see, and not a soul among our numbers who will not wish to praise the saviour of Baldur's Gate.

26.speaker: Player
26.context: NodeContext: 'You know me - I'm a free agent'

99.speaker: Halsin
99.text: We are each free, as we always were... but that does not need to be the end.
99.context: NodeContext: 'You know me - I'm a free agent'

11.speaker: Halsin
11.text: I wish we had been afforded more time together, but there is so much to do in the wake of the Absolute's defeat, and precious few hands with which to do it.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Forget the world - stay with me.

68.speaker: Halsin
68.text: I cannot. No matter how much I want to.
